page.title: 11ALRESFORD TOURISM
page.content: Alresford with its river walks along the Arle and good trout fishing, is a picturesque country town. The Watercress Railway, reopened, in 1977 revives memories of steam. The Fulling Mill is a delightful 15 Century thatched and half timbered cottage.It stradles the river and was built when the wool trade in the area was important. The water was used in 'fulling', a complicated procedure to clean wool, in which Fuller's earth was used. At the bottom of Broad street is an old Inn, The Globe, behind which is a large expanse of water. This lake was originally caused by the work of Bishop de Lucy in 1190, he had the river dammed at this point. It is now a haven for wildlife. The Studio Bookshop in Broad street has guides and walks around the town.
